intro: Stenogyne laevis, commonly known as the smooth stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has smooth, glabrous leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streamside areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
